messages.text:
Hi all,

I have plans to pursue further studies in Melbourne. During my studies, it would be great if I had a part-time/casual job that involves my skills in mathematics and Julia programming. Does anyone have any leads on such a possibility?

Thanks in advance.

elements.text:
Hi all,

I have plans to pursue further studies in Melbourne. During my studies, it would be great if I had a part-time/casual job that involves my skills in mathematics and Julia programming. Does anyone have any leads on such a possibility?

Thanks in advance.

messages.text: Start by finding a project that interests you on GitHub, contribute to it. Then apply for GSoC to get some more experience. You can find a list of potential projects in <https://julialang.org/jsoc/projects/>. Ask on <#C67L30Z3L|jsoc> about specific projects that interest you. Once you have a few contributions and you make yourself known, there are a few opportunities available. A few companies welcome interns or part-time remote work arrangements. But you need to strengthen your profile using open source contributions. If the project you are interested in is also deep pocketed, then you can work for the maintainer of the project.

attachments.title: Projects
attachments.text: The official website for the Julia Language. Julia is a language that is fast, dynamic, easy to use, and open source. Click here to learn more.

messages.text: if we meet in Melbourne after the lockdown. what kinda things would ppl be interested in? a book club?
